intro: Macrocarpaea jensii, commonly known as the coastal macrocarpaea, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is adapted to salt spray and coastal winds. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly known as the ice plant family. Macrocarpaea jensii is often used in coastal landscaping due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
